description: Tahajjud is a voluntary night prayer offered after Isha and before Fajr. It is performed in the last part of the night, preferably after waking up from sleep. It is a deeply spiritual form of worship that brings the believer closer to Allah and is a mark of sincerity and devotion.

importance.text: And during the night, wake up for prayer as an extra offering for you; it may be that your Lord will raise you to a praised station.
Their sides forsake their beds; they call upon their Lord in fear and hope, and they spend [in charity] from what We have given them.

virtues: It brings you closer to Allah
Your duas are more likely to be accepted
It's the best prayer after the obligatory ones
It erases sins and lifts your status in the Hereafter

hadiths.text: The best prayer after the obligatory prayers is the night prayer (Tahajjud).
Our Lord descends every night to the lowest heaven when one-third of the night remains and says: ‘Who is calling upon Me so that I may respond to him?’

recommended_time: Last third of the night (approximately 2/3 into the night until Fajr)
how_to_pray: Sleep after Isha with the intention to wake up for Tahajjud
Wake up during the last part of the night
Pray 2 rak’ahs at a time, minimum of 2, no maximum
Recite long Surahs if possible, and make heartfelt duas
You may end your Tahajjud with Witr prayer (if not prayed earlier)
etiquettes: Maintain consistency even if praying just 2 rak’ahs
Make dua with humility and presence of heart
Ask for forgiveness, guidance, and closeness to Allah
benefits: Removes sins and elevates your rank
Softens the heart and strengthens Iman
Increases focus and sincerity in other acts of worship
